title: 111_hr786
content: SECTION 1. PERMANENT INCREASE IN DEPOSIT INSURANCE. Amendments to the Federal Deposit Insurance Act include increasing the insured amount from $100,000 to $250,000 and changing certain dates and terms within the Act. Amendment to the Federal Credit Union Act increases insured amount from $100,000 to $250,000. No provision of law, except for specific acts, can override this change. The Federal Credit Union Act allows the Board of Directors of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and the National Credit Union Administration Board to adjust assessments and insurance premiums for insured credit unions. SEC. 2 amends the restoration plan period from 5 to 8 years. SEC. 3 increases FDIC borrowing authority to $100 billion and NCUA borrowing authority to $6 billion. SEC. 4 expands systemic risk special assessments. Section 13(c)(4)(G)(ii) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act is amended to allow the Corporation to recover losses from insured depository institutions through special assessments. The Corporation may prescribe regulations to implement clauses related to depository institution holding companies, with sections 7(c)(2) and 18(h) applying as if they were insured depository institutions. The Corporation will establish assessment rates to cover losses incurred from its actions, considering entities benefiting, economic conditions, industry effects, and other relevant factors. Excess funds collected will be placed in the Deposit Insurance Fund. Establishment of a National Credit Union Share Insurance Fund Restoration Plan Period. The Federal Credit Union Act is amended to include a new subparagraph regarding Fund restoration plans when the equity ratio falls below a specified amount. The Board must establish a Share Insurance Fund restoration plan within 90 days if the equity ratio falls below a certain level. The plan must ensure the Fund's equity ratio meets or exceeds the minimum amount within a 5-year period. The Board must publish a detailed analysis of the factors considered and actions taken within 30 days of implementing a Share Insurance Fund restoration plan to ensure the equity ratio meets or exceeds the minimum amount within a 5-year period.
